before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"dpng7","text":"This protocol applies specifically to NCBI pathogen genome submissions falling within the scope of Pathogen Detection efforts (see here). Briefly, this includes whole genome sequence data submissions of bacterial pathogens.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":131,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"fh3ek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"allst","text":"For curation requests for data that align with these criteria, the NCBI Pathogen Detection team will serve as your primary contact at NCBI: pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov. They will coordinate with other NCBI databases to manage each curation request, covering BioSample, BioProject, SRA, GenBank, and Pathogen Detection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":140,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"9d0cf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bkec","text":"For NCBI submissions that fall outside the purview of the Pathogen Detection pipeline, including viral genomes, targeted amplicon datasets, data derived from NGS pathogen panels, or, specifically, SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater, the curation process will be performed by each respective database team. Protocol in development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D66B6CA7D26011EEB00E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens/organisms"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D32A30F4CCDF11EE973C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"41p3a","text":"PURPOSE: After data are submitted to NCBI submitters often encounter the need to update, retract, or replace these records. This is called data curation. This protocol provides instructions for making data curation requests at NCBI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8um9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r0um","text":"SCOPE: This protocol applies specifically to NCBI pathogen genome submissions falling within the scope of Pathogen Detection efforts (see here). Briefly, this includes whole genome sequence data submissions of bacterial pathogens, which is the primary submission type for FDA's GenomeTrakr network.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":138,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"f5j6j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt785","text":"Version history:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2svco","text":"V5: Significant edits to the protocol including new guidance for primary contacts at NCBI. This protocol was also forked, with the current version focused on whole genome sequence data for bacterial pathogens, and the other protocol (in development) focusing on other data types for pathogens (metagenomic, targeted amplicon, other enrichment panels). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl53q","text":"V4: Clarifying protocol for SRA retraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"864tp","text":"V3: Update to BioSample section, providing further guidance on updating taxonomic names. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmpac","text":"V2. Edit submissions using the NCBI portal (Manage data). Moved \"how to find my data\" content to a new protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D66B6CA7D26011EEB00E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens/organisms"}}}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7upn","text":"This method is under development and assessment for suitability of use. It is likely that modifications will be made to improve the method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

forks.title: NCBI data curation protocol (non-bacterial pathogens ONLY) - SOP for editing less common GenomeTrakr submissions

manuscript_citation: Timme, R.E., Wolfgang, W.J., Balkey, M. et al. Optimizing open data to support one health: best practices to ensure interoperability of genomic data from bacterial pathogens. One Health Outlook 2, 20 (2020). https://doi.org/10.1186/s42522-020-00026-3. Timme R.E., Sanchez Leon M., Allard M.W. (2019) Utilizing the Public GenomeTrakr Database for Foodborne Pathogen Traceback. In: Bridier A. (eds) Foodborne Bacterial Pathogens. Methods in Molecular Biology, vol 1918. Humana, New York, NY. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-1-4939-9000-9_17

steps.section: BioSample Curation for records included NCBI Pathogen Detection
BioSample Curation for records included NCBI Pathogen Detection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4rmet","text":"All edits or updates to PD BioSample records are submitted via email to PD-help: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47paf","text":"TO:  pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iqif","text":"Send all change and retraction requests to PD-help, so they can ensure all linked records are\nchanged (GenBank, etc.).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aoi16","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kb8a","text":"Use this email for the following tasks. Include your lab and the request date in your subject\nline for easy tracking, eg “FDA BioSample update, Dec 10, 2019”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rh57","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhs98","text":"Questions about validation errors or processing of a BioSample submission.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl0ks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at481","text":"Update, correct, or add fields/attributes to a BioSample(s)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dkao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6k6ak","text":"Retraction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvold","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3er64","text":"Add a linkage or re-assign linkage to a BioProject","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s6n9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drqk9","text":"Add or change a strain or isolate field to an existing BioSample where one has been lacking (necessary for the isolate's assembly to appear in GenBank). NOTE, there is now a list of terms that results in a failure to process the isolate and it will not be processed at all in Pathogen Detection. Do not use these terms in the strain/isolate fields:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cdkc","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55mia","text":"bacteria ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev81i","text":"sp. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf6u6","text":"strain ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9avu","text":"environmental ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t617","text":"soil ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhj","text":"clinical isolate ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66h1p","text":"NA ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjpop","text":"whole organism","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al4eb","text":"Microbial","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5771","text":"Any kind of taxonomic information, such as genus name or species name","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m6uo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8u1v","text":"Taxonomic updates: send to \"pd-help@ncbi.hlm.nih.gov\" on these requests to ensure taxonomic changes get propagated fully across NCBI databases. The organism’s name should include the binomial name (Genus species), subspecies where present, plus serovar/serotype information. In cases where the BioSample attributes serovar/serotype were populated (e.g. with traditional serotyping results), ensure they are also updated as needed. Special note about Salmonella enterica isolates: please submit or update serotyping information in the serovar field, not the serotype field.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nqct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98qd3","text":"You will receive a confirmation email that the updates were performed. These types of transactions are common for this database, so do not hesitate to submit requests as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ntco","text":"SRA retraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bar4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5527","text":"An SRA record should only be retracted for the following reasons:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mifs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn0t1","text":"Discovery of poor quality data.  Lab intends to re-generate data (starting at appropriate wet-lab step, re-isolation, DNA extraction, library prep, or sequencing) and re-submit the data.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51a1e","text":"Sample mix-ups that cannot be resolved by re-parenting or correcting the BioSamples. Lab intends to re-generate (starting at appropriate wet-lab step, re-isolation, DNA extraction, library prep, or sequencing) and re-submit the data.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q1sv","text":"Discovery of multiple runs per isolate. Laboratory would like to have only one run per isolate in the system.  No re-sequencing planned.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i5h7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5c7gi","text":"DO NOT retract an SRA submission, then attempt to re-submit the same files.
